Hypo Class

Defined in: lib\hypo.js:5

Hypo dependency injection framework constructor.

Constructor

Hypo

(
  • definitions
)

Defined in lib\hypo.js:5

Parameters:

  • definitions Object

    An object that defines the entities and their dependencies to be managed by this Hypo instance. See readme for a full example of a hypo configuration object.

Methods

applyProperties

(
  • entity
  • propertyDefinitions
)

Defined in lib\hypo.js:163

Applies properties to an entity instance based on the passed set of property definitions. See parseProperty for a description of appropriate Hypo property definitions.

Parameters:

  • entity Object

    An entity instance to apply the parsed properties to.

  • propertyDefinitions Object

    An object with keys corresponding to the properties to be applied to the entity, and Hypo property definition values.

createEntity

(
  • ctor
  • argDefs
  • entityName
  • context
)

Defined in lib\hypo.js:107

Creates a new object using the passed constructor function and argument property definitions. See parseProperty for a description of appropriate Hypo property definitions.

Parameters:

  • ctor Function

    The constructor function to be invoked with the parsed argument definitions.

  • argDefs Array

    An array of Hypo property definitions

  • entityName String

    The name of the entity being constructed; used to check for circular dependencies.

  • context Object

    The context in which to call the constructor; used when applying factory methods.

generateSingletons

() Void

Defined in lib\hypo.js:47

Generates the non-lazy singleton entities managed by this instance. This method is called when the hypo instance is constructed, and does not need to be called again.

Returns:

Void:

getEntity

(
  • name
)
Object

Defined in lib\hypo.js:64

The method for retrieving entities. If an entity is a singleton and not particularly lazy, it will have been created along with the Hypo instance. Otherwise, it will be created the first time it is requested in the case of lazy singletons, and each time in the case of transient entities.

Parameters:

  • name String

    Corresponds to the key in definitions representing the entity definition to retieve an instance of.

Returns:

Object: The entity instance generated from the definition corresponding with the passed name.

parseDefinition

(
  • name
)
Object

Defined in lib\hypo.js:227

Parses the definition for the passed name, including recursing through any parent definitions, and merging parent and child properties where needed.

Parameters:

  • name String

    Then entity name to parse

Returns:

Object: The parsed definition

parseProperty

(
  • prop
)

Defined in lib\hypo.js:180

Parses Hypo property definitions. These definitions are used for constructor arguments, factory arguments, and property definitions. Valid property objects are as follows:

Parameters:

  • prop Object

    A valid Hypo property definition

Returns:

An entity, hypo instance, or value based on the passed property

Example:

Passing an object with a hypo key returns a reference to the Hypo instance

{
    hypo : true    
}

Passing an object with an entity key equal to an entity name returns an entity instance.

{
    entity : "entity name"
}

Passing an object with a key "value" returns that value.

{
    value : "object or primitive value"
}

Any other object configuration will result in an error being thrown.

Properties

definitions

Object

Defined in lib\hypo.js:15

The entity definition object for this Hypo instance.

HypoError

Function

Defined in lib\hypo.js:33

Custom error constructor for framework specific errors

singletonMap

Object

Defined in lib\hypo.js:22

A map of all singleton entities managed by this instance.
